greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of permutations with given cycle structure, in the prime factorization order.
comment: Number of permutations with k1 1-cycles, k2 2-cycles, ...
link: Gheorghe Coserea, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Permutation cycle
formula: For n=p1^k1*p2^k2*... where 2=p1<p2<... are the sequence of all primes, a(n) = a([k1,k2,...]) = (k1+2*k2+...)!/((k1!*k2!*...)*(1^k1*2^k2*...)
mathematica: a[1] = 1; a[n_] := (f1 = FactorInteger[n]; rr = Range[PrimePi[f1[[-1, 1]]]]; f2 = {Prime[#], 0}& /@ rr; ff = Union[f1, f2] //. {b___, {p_, 0}, {p_, k_}, c___} -> {b, {p, k}, c}; kk = ff[[All, 2]]; (kk.rr)!/Times @@ (kk!)/Times @@ (rr^kk)); Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 02 2018 *)
program: vector(51, n, a(n)) \\ _Gheorghe Coserea_, Feb 02 2018; edited by _Max Alekseyev_, Feb 05 2018
results.author: _Max Alekseyev_, Nov 07 2006
